section.text: Augmentation dots and tenuto ties are two types of markings used to alter a note's duration.
A dot increases duration by one half.
Since a quaver note is half the duration of a crotchet note, we will substitute it for the 1/2 symbol above.
As you can see, a dotted crotchet note is equal to a crotchet note plus a quaver note.
A dotted crotchet can also equal three quaver notes.
Ties merge multiple notes of the same pitch. They are used to let the duration of a note travel across barriers (such as the bar line in the above example).
As you listen, notice how the fourth and fifth note are combined.
If the bar line was not there, we could have simply written a minim note for the tied crotchet notes.
